Dear Mr. Jenningsi
First of all let me say I'm sorry our schedules
did not work out for February 5th. I had looked for¬
ward to sitting down with you and discussing this
Utilisation Information Kit Project. By now I*111 sure
Lis Marshall has told you of our discussion. I had
intended to write you sooner but have held off, pend¬
ing a reply to my official request to Dr. Willis.
This letter went to him on January litth and I am be¬
ginning to wonder if something may have happened to
his reply since I have not heard from him as yet. In
any case, I sent him another letter today.
It would be impossible for me to cover in a letter
all of the details and Kit possibilities that we dis¬
cussed. Basically, what we would like to have is a
Kit of slides with an accompanying tape recording demon¬
strating utilisation of school broadcasts in the Chicago
schools. We would like to have these organised in such
a way that they would be aimed at a specific audience.
The committee hopee to extend this project over
several years if necessary. Our first objective is to
find the existing material and see if this can be made
available. After this is done, we hope to secure the
funds to produce specific Utilisation Kits to fill in
those areas where material is lacking.
As for the form these kits will take, we envisage
the use of films, tape recordings, film stripes, slides,
models, planned demonstrations and printed material.
The committee is not trying to set up a specific format
for the Kits, but would like to keep their planning
flexible enough to make use of every type of present¬
ation.
